fields.name: Bonny
fields.profile:
Bonny came into Phibsboro Cat Rescue’s care when she was rescued from a colony in Blackrock.

 

She was the runt of the litter and her mother sadly rejected her. Bonny is a nervous girl who often hisses when she is approached. However, this is simply because she is so scared, not because she is in any way aggressive, and she generally relaxes and purrs once her foster carer strokes her. She is gentle and never scratches even when she feels threatened.

 

Although it is a slow process, she is beginning to settle in and grow more comfortable in her new environment. Bonny is very independent and may never be a lap cat. However, she has started showing an interest in toys and will eat from her human’s hand on occasion, both of which are big achievements! She is also fully litter trained.

 

Bonny is ready to be adopted, but only by an experienced and patient cat-owner who understands that she is still hissy and anxious. We think that she would be happy as an indoor-only cat because she shows little interest in exploring, but we don’t know whether she could be adopted into a household with children, cats or other pets yet.

fields.name: Theresa
fields.profile:
This gorgeous girl was rescued by the PCR rescue team on the 11/11/20 in Ballyfermot.

 

Theresa is an independent girl who is ready to be adopted, she loves a good belly rub and loves to sneak in smaller spaces like cupboards! Theresa is not only an indoor cat, she loves going on adventures outside too! Theresa is not suitable for houses which have other pets; she has to be the only girl in your life and she will make the puurfect feline companion. There is no indication that she would not be suited with children under 12 as she is an affectionate kitty and loves to be around people.

 

Anyone would be lucky enough to have Theresa as their own, she needs someone to give her a furrrever home.

fields.name: Marvin
fields.status: Ready to be adopted at 8 weeks
fields.description: Black with white chest and paws
fields.profile:
Marvin was rescued from Kildare after his mama died after being hit by a car.

 

Marvin is a cutie pie, a very friendly and loving boy. He is a new member of the PCR family, so we do not have detailed info about his personality. What we know so far is, he is full of energy, playful and always exploring. He searches for food and attention. He doesn't mind being handled and often hops on the couch for rubs. Marvin is not yet ready for adoption.

 

As he is friendly, he might be good to be adopted with other pets or children and he seems happy indoors (fosterer needs more time to confirm this). Also, he is still learning how to use his litter tray but other than that he is settling in well.

fields.name: Max
fields.profile:
Handsome Max was rescued when he was found straying in Newbridge, Co Kildare.

 

Very likely to be a papa to many kitties in Kildare, he is now neutered and awaiting a lovely fur-ever home. Max is doing really well in foster care. He has more and more interest in toys these days, is very relaxed, and likes to spend time on the coach. He loves food and tends to screech a bit when his foster carer is around the kitchen if he hasn’t eaten in a few hours. Max uses the scratching post a lot. He is receiving treatment for his laboured breathing, which is slightly better than it had been during his first week in foster care. We don't know how well he gets with other cats, dogs and young children.

fields.name: Rodney
fields.profile:
Rodney was rescued when he was straying in the stairwell near Phoenix Park, Dublin 15. Rodney is the newest member of the PCR family.

 

He is still recovering from his surgery. So far what we know about him is, Rodney is a sweet, loving, friendly boy. He loves being petted and plays with his toys all day. He has a great appetite, eats wet as well as dry food and uses a litter tray as a good boy. As he was a stray cat, he meows a lot for food and settles quickly with little petting. Sometimes he likes to sit on his fosterer’s lap and relax. Rodney is a gentle soul and looking for a loving home. We don’t know how well he gets with other cats, dogs and small children.

fields.name: Ruthy
fields.profile:
Ruthy - a tabby girl is a new member of the PCR family.

 

She is very loving and lil shy. As she is new to the surrounding, she is still nervous and spends most of the time on the couch. She lets her fosterer touch her, and she loves tickle under her chin. So far, she has not shown interest in treats and not eating much. She is housetrained, always uses her litter tray to do her business. We don’t know yet how well she gets with other cats, dogs and young children.

fields.name: The Boys
fields.description: One Black, one black and white
fields.profile:
O’scannaill vet asked PCR to rehome these beautiful kitties.

 

These kitties are bonded with each other, always together, sitting on each other (haha). They are still very shy, don’t like to be handled but come out of hiding for food. They still hiss but let the fosterer pet a bit. They are very playful, active at night and can be mischievous and are prone to swiping anything off shelf. When they are in mood, they like to chase mouse on a string. They are slowly becoming social.

fields.name: Rupert
fields.profile:
Who could resist this noble looking chap?

 

Meet Rupert – this handsome devil was rescued as part of a colony in Swords and is currently getting to know the kindness of humans at his fosterers’ house.

 

Understandably, Rupert is still a bit shy and prefers to be close to places he can hide – behind the curtain is so far his favourite spot. He is eating well and has used the litterbox with no trouble. He can be coaxed by petting and treats and has started to explore his surroundings by jumping on everything and by looking to play when he feels comfortable. Once he starts to trust a little more, we are sure he will make a lovely pet.

fields.notice: CURRENT HOLD ON ADOPTIONS. Due to a high level of enquiries we are not currently adding names to our waiting list. Please keep an aye on our website and Facebook page for updates.
